summary: This document is an email chain between attorneys discussing a discovery request for statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in July 2019. The request is made under Rule 16 and FOIA procedures, with the U.S. Attorney's Office agreeing to produce relevant statements.

persons.name: Michael Bachrach
persons.context: Attorney forwarding an email exchange regarding a discovery request for statements by Nicholas Tartaglione about Jeffrey Epstein's suicide attempt. He confirms the request is made under Rule 16.

persons.name: Bruce Barket
persons.context: Attorney at Barket Epstein Kearon Aldea & LoTurco, LLP who initiated the request for statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione concerning Epstein's suicide attempt. He forwards the request to Michael Bachrach.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: Inmate who was interviewed by Bureau of Prisons personnel regarding Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in July 2019. His statements are being sought through discovery.

persons.name: Aida Leisenring
persons.context: Copied on email correspondence regarding the request for Tartaglione's statements. Likely a paralegal or legal assistant involved in the case.

persons.name: Tony Ricco
persons.context: Copied on the initial email from Michael Bachrach regarding the discovery request for Tartaglione's statements.

persons.name: Kenneth J.
persons.context: Mentioned in the email header as a recipient, likely another attorney or legal professional involved in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Deceased financier and sex offender whose reported suicide attempt in July 2019 is the subject of the requested statements from Nicholas Tartaglione.

connections.description: Legal colleagues communicating about a discovery request regarding Tartaglione's statements about Epstein's suicide attempt.
Barket is seeking statements made by Tartaglione, suggesting a legal representation or investigative interest in his account.
Tartaglione was interviewed about Epstein's reported suicide attempt, indicating he may have witnessed or had information about the incident.

events.title: Epstein's Reported Suicide Attempt
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein's reported attempted suicide attempt at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), which prompted an interview with inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Discovery Request for Tartaglione Statements
events.description: Email correspondence between attorneys discussing a formal request for statements made by Nicholas Tartaglione regarding Epstein's suicide attempt.

keyFacts: Nicholas Tartaglione was interviewed by Bureau of Prisons personnel about Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in late July 2019.
Attorneys Bruce Barket and Michael Bachrach are seeking Tartaglione's statements through Rule 16 discovery and FOIA procedures.
The U.S. Attorney's Office agreed to produce any statements in their possession by the end of the week following November 18, 2019.
The request highlights ongoing legal interest in the circumstances surrounding Epstein's death while in custody.
